properties.areaDesc: Martin, IN; Daviess, IN; Dubois, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 9:35AM EST until January 20 at 1:51AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...

.As of Wednesday morning, minor to moderate flooding either
continues or is forecast on the Wabash, White, and East Fork White
Rivers in central and southern Indiana. This flooding is the result
of up to about 4 inches of rain that fell late last week.

Crests will be/are comparable to those that occurred in February
and June of 2019.

The Wabash River is either cresting or slightly past crest from
Covington to Terre Haute.  The crest will reach Hutsonville
Friday.  The White River crest is between Elliston and
Newberry.  The crest along the East Fork White River is nearing
nearing Rivervale. Flooding along the lower portions of the White
and Wabash River is likely to continue until the weekend of
January 25.

Little or no precipitation is in the forecast through Thursday,
which will allow drainage to continue out of area rivers this week.
Above normal precipitation is possible this coming Friday through
Saturday, which could exacerbate elevated water levels and lead to
renewed flooding on area waterways.  Precipitation is expected to
start off as snow then transition to rain late Friday into Friday
night.

The Flood Warning continues for
The East Fork White River at Shoals.
* until late Sunday night.
* At  8:30 AM Wednesday the stage was 19.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by this morning and continue to
rise to near 22.9 feet by Friday afternoon.  It will fall below
flood stage by Sunday afternoon.
* At 22.5 feet...West River Road east from Shoals flooded in at least
two locations.  Residential area near McBrides Bluff isolated by
high water.  Low lying county roads east of McBrides Bluff also
flooded.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
